1536836748_1JcHMiQxXHX9q3ZK2LF9rZjvg3MUt.body: I would never have found Linux without a search engine because I'd need a site talking about linux and without being able to search info on it I'd still think Linux was a single OS and never have even heard Ubuntu outside of it being used as whatever the African phrase was. Simple reality is a search engine is going to be needed when ZeroNet gets bigger simply because the amount of information is going to grow to big to navigate without one.

> [kaffie](#comment_674_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Can't search for something if you don't know what it is. [...]

Long term the best way to do a search engine might be to update zeronet to make it searchable somehow. Also most times someone uses a search engine they are trying to find more information on something. For example I know what email is. I would use a search engine to find email providers. Search engines aren't used for discovery but rather research.

However I don't necessarily think it needs to work in the same way as clear-net ones. The purpose of a search engine is to organize the network it searches. Therefore maybe it would be feasible to create a standard that would allow quickly indexing a site with minimal data needed (my guess for an implementation would be to have some kind of standard xml format where a search engine need only to parse the xml, bypassing the page itself.I'm not a programmer though so I'm probably not the best person to try to create an implementation). However a search engine really is needed. Maybe you as an individual don't need one and that's fine. I personally use ecosia regularly and many other people use various other search engines.

If nothing else the clear-net has shown that there is demand for a way to search the contents of a computer network and so while whether or not that demand is justified is debatable, since the demand is there ZeroNet won't take of without it. Right now this whole thread seems to be a debate on whether or not we need to organize the data contained in ZeroNet. I haven't seen much discussion on how to do it. As the thread title is attempting to explore methods to create one people just coming to say "I don't use one and therefore nobody needs one" are being counterproductive and derailing the thread.
